issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: I was always wondering why we don't do that, for the people who run HS2 and also need metastore due to it being used externally; they don't need to run a standalone metastore.

comments.body: Simple patch. Calls the horrible static init method; also cleans up some init.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12791889/HIVE-13221.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12792324 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

as of HIVE-11388 it is safe to start multiple instance of ACID background task.  
Prior to HIVE-11388, it was expected that hive.compactor.initiator.on = true for only 1 standalone metastore in the cluster (not enforced).
This prop is checked in HiveMetaStore before stating these threads (except for Worker which was always ok to have multiple instance of).
Further, before HIVE-11388, the expectation was that only 1 instance of each thread (except Worker) is started in the single metastore instance.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12792324/HIVE-13221.01.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12792324 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build

Well, to the original question, the threads are not started because this ticket is about exposing APIs ;)
I just added the comment to avoid confusion as the init is kind of convoluted.
